summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General memorandum documenting a voluntary telephonic interview conducted on March 21, 2022, with a former General Foreman of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center New York. The interview is part of an OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein, focusing on the MCC New York's camera system upgrade contract and related issues.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General is investigating the death of BOP inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) who was housed at MCC New York.
A former General Foreman of BOP at MCC New York was interviewed on March 21, 2022, regarding camera system upgrades at the facility in 2018.
The investigation includes review of a September 21, 2018, contract award for camera system upgrades at MCC New York.
The document references emails from January and April 2019 regarding camera and fiber cable issues at MCC New York.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, with the recording saved separately due to large file size.
